Authors: Yun-Jiao Liu, Juan Liu, Chi-Ming Hu
Title:
Non-monophyly of Primula subgenera Auganthus and Carolinella
(Primlaceae) as confirmed by the nuclear DNA sequence variation
Keywords:
ITS â¢ Circumscription â¢ Auganthus â¢ Carolinella â¢
Primula â¢ Primulaceae
Abstract:
An earlier molecular phylogenetic analysis using cpDNA
sequence data revealed the non-monophyly of Primula subgenera Auganthus
and Carolinella, and evolutionary implication of the infrageneric
division of this two groups remains uncertain. In the present study, 130
new sequences were newly analyzed, with the combination of plastid genes
and nrDNA ITS regions through Maximum parsimony and Bayesian inference
analyses. It confirms that neither subgenus Auganthus nor subgenus
Carolinella is monophyletic in their current circumscription. The
calyptrate capsule as a diagnostic morphological criterion for subgenus
Carolinella may have experienced multiple occurrences in Primula.
Subgenus Auganthus would be a natural group only if with inclusion of
subgenus Carolinella and exclusion of P. aromatica. Positions of some
infrageneric groups are clarified, challenges remain regarding relevant
morphological characters for sectional delimitations within subgenus
Auganthus.
